components.description:
A dolphin, a sleek marine mammal known to be social and intelligent. Generally depicted as a light-blue dolphin with a white belly in full profile facing left, its short snout curving down to a prominent dorsal fin and tail, as a bottlenose dolphin leaping in the air.

May be used for various content concerning swimming, oceans, beaches, and summer fun. Not be confused with ü¶à Shark.

WhatsApp and Facebook’s dolphins are gray, as Microsoft and Samsung’s previously were.
components.title: Dolphin

title: Dolphin

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A dolphin emoji, leaping in the air. Considered to be one of the most intelligent animals on Earth. Dolphin was approved as part of Unicode  http://emojipedia.org/dolphin/
emoji_net_data.name: dolphin

bn:13655893v: To lift one or both flipper out of the water and slap the surface of the water

bn:00034509n: Appendage of a cetacean or other marine animal.
A similar appendage of a cetacean or other marine animal.
Organ of locomotion and balance in fishes and some other aquatic animals
An appendage of a fish used for swimming.
A fin is a thin component or appendage attached to a larger body or structure.

bn:00028133n: A carnivorous aquatic mammal inhabiting mostly in the shallower seas of the continental shelves.
Aquatic mammals related to Porpoises and Whales
Dolphins are cetacean mammals closely related to whales and porpoises.
Marine mammals, closely related to whales and porpoises
Dolphins are marine mammals that are closely related to whales and porpoises.
A carnivorous aquatic mammal inhabiting mostly in the shallower seas of the continental shelves, famed for its intelligence and occasional willingness to approach humans.
Any of various small toothed whales with a beaklike snout; larger than porpoises

bn:00034816n: Any of various mostly cold-blooded aquatic vertebrates usually having scales and breathing through gills
Fish anatomy is the study of the form or morphology of fishes.

bn:00069946n: The sea, the world ocean, or simply the ocean, is the connected body of salty water that covers 70.8% of the Earth's surface.
A large body of salty water. (Major seas are known as oceans.)
A sea is a large body of saline water usually connected with an ocean.
A division of an ocean or a large body of salt water partially enclosed by land
The body of water covering most of Earth
A body of salt water that is smaller than an ocean and generally in proximity to a continent.

bn:00035253n: Forelimb evolved for movement through water
In marine mammals such as whales, a wide flat limb, adapted for swimming
A flipper is a typically flat forelimb evolved for movement through water.
The flat broad limb of aquatic animals specialized for swimming

bn:00009263n: A lat, narrow strip of sand, gravel or pebbles along the shoreline of a body of water (ocean, river, lake).
An area of sand sloping down to the water of a sea or lake
A beach is a landform along the coast of an ocean, sea, lake, or river.
The shore of a body of water, especially when sandy or pebbly.
Landform along the shoreline of an ocean, sea, lake, or river

bn:00058574n: The oceans, seas, bays, estuaries, and other major water bodies, including coastal marine and nearshore zones.
The mass of water occupying all of the Earth's surface not occupied by land, but excluding all lakes and inland seas.
Oceans are major bodies of saline water, and the principal component of the hydrosphere.
A large body of water constituting a principal part of the hydrosphere
An ocean is a body of saline water that composes much of a planet's hydrosphere.

apple_vendor_description: Apple‚Äôs dolphin emoji leaps with a dynamic grace, its sleek body rendered in a shimmering, aquatic blue with Apple‚Äôs signature glossy 3D shading that catches the light beautifully. On Apple devices, the dolphin‚Äôs smooth, rounded form and playful posture evoke a sense of freedom, joy, and intelligence. This emoji is frequently used to represent the ocean, marine life, or to convey feelings of happiness, optimism, and playful exploration in messages.
